title: The Schedule page is one large vertical scroller
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
custom_expected: Then the user will see one big vertical scroller sectioned out by round/pool/venue

title: Each subhead for each round indicates the pool name, the date range, the venue, and the location
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
custom_expected: Then the user will see a subhead under each round number the pool name, the date range, the venue, and the location

title: Each pool has a color and particular venue
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
custom_expected: Then the user will see a specific colored location & venue for each pool to the right of the round number & date range

title: The top of the Schedule page will have navigation buttons
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
custom_steps: When the user looks at the top of the page
custom_expected: Then they will see a navigation bar with buttons for Qualifiers, Round 1, Round 2, & Championship Round.

title: Tapping the navigation buttons at the top of the Schedule page will bring you to the corresponding section of the schedule
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Qualifiers, Round 1, Round 2, or Championship Round navigational button
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the corresponding section of the schedule

title: When tapping on the 'T' button from the schedule page, a webview will open with standard browser controls and a 'Done' button
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
And a game has tickets available indicated by the presence of a 'T' button under the Tickets column
custom_steps: When the user taps on the 'T' button
custom_expected: Then the user will be presented with a webview equipped with standard browser controls and a 'Done' button

title: When tapping the 'Done' button on the tickets webview, the user will be returned to the Schedule page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app 
And has navigated to the Schedule from the navigational drop down
And a game has tickets available indicated by the presence of a 'T' button under the Tickets column
And the user taps on the 'T' button to launch the webview
custom_steps: When the user taps on the 'Done' button
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought back to the Schedule page

title: The schedule page is one large vertical scroller
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And navigated to the Schedule from the 'More' section
custom_expected: Then the user will see one big vertical scroller sectioned out by round/pool/venue

title: Each subhead for each round indicates the pool name, the date range, venue, and location

custom_expected: Then the user will see a subhead for each round indicating the pool name, the date range, venue, and location
